abstract: The ratings agency objected to a Securities and Exchange Commission proposal to require it to publicly disclose its mistakes.
snippet: The ratings agency objected to a Securities and Exchange Commission proposal to require it to publicly disclose its mistakes.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Three days after Treasury Department officials discovered what they called a mistake in the assumptions used by Standard & Poor’s to justify the downgrade of United States debt, the president of S.& P. wrote to securities regulators saying that ratings agencies should not be required to publicly disclose all errors in their calculations.

headline.main: S.&P., Accused of Faulty Math, Fights Error Disclosure Rule
headline.print_headline: S.&P., Accused of Faulty Math in Downgrade, Fights Error Disclosure Rule

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
